CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1953, page 1, reads: "Belmar Gardens Given Green Light - Oakley W. Heselbarth, district director of the Federal Housing Administration, signed a commitment guaranteeing a mortgage of $1,212,900 for the construction of Belmar Gardens, 118-unit development, which is the first cooperative housing project to be built in the Pittsburgh district. With Mr. Heselbarth, seated, are, left to right, Roland M. Sawyer, assistant director, who became interested in the Belmar Gardens project while he was employed by the Federal Housing Administration; William Brafman, builder and sponsor, and Clarence Rogers, manager of the new housing development. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Oakley W. Heselbarth seated at desk signing mortgage for Belmar Gardens Federal Housing, and standing from left: Roland M. Sawyer, William Brafman, and Clarence Rogers, gathered in office
